channel.title: nsx on Chris Neales Blog
channel.description: Recent content in nsx on Chris Neales Blog

item.title: VMworld Europe Schedule and New things to do this time
item.description: I’ve filled up my schedule, I’ve Favourited sessions that were full so I can check the standby queues out and here’s a few other things I want to tick off this time round at VMworld I might have some tapas and a cerveza too. But just the one!

item.title: Training Resource Review - Pluralsight + Jason Nash's NSX Courses
item.description: In a recent change of tack to my learning plan I’ve moved from revising VCAP-DCA to VCP-NV. This has been driven by a need for work to be familiar with NSX and Multi-Hypervisor Virtualised Networking too. I did a couple of the NSX Hands On Labs last October at VMworld but other than a few terms, and the fact some bits looked a lot like vShield from the vCloud Suite most of it had leaked out of my brain.

item.title: VMware News Roundup - Announcement-ageddon!!!
item.description: There was armageddon, then snowmageddon and now announcementageddon. Twitter is on fire with frantic retweeting and updates on what people are excited about on the VMware front. And there’s plenty to be excited about right now. The biggest unsurprising but best bit is vSphere 6.0 goes GA. Now everyone can try long distance vmotion, VVols, 4vcpu Fault Tolerance, Instant Clone and more. Register for a trial and download below https://my.vmware.com/group/vmware/evalcenter?p=vsphere6#src=vmw_so_vex_cneal_850
